snippet: After the N.H.L. spent months promoting safety and dozens of players had concussions, the amount of dangerous hits and questionable tactics so far in the playoffs has been startling.
abstract: Signature images of the NHL postseason have been brawls, dangerous hits and questionable tactics, a particularly startling development after the league spent months promoting safety and dozens of players had concussions.

byline.contributor: Jeff Z. Klein contributed reporting from Ottawa, Joanne C. Gerstner from Detroit and Dave Caldwell from Voorhees, N.J.

lead_paragraph: After the N.H.L. spent months promoting safety and dozens of players had concussions, the amount of dangerous hits and questionable tactics so far in the playoffs has been startling.

headline.seo: Fists Are Up, and So Are Penalties in N.H.L. Playoffs
headline.main: Fists Are Up, and So Are the Penalties
headline.print_headline: In Round 1 of Playoffs, the Fists Have Been Up, and So Have the Penalties
